en.purpose: To assess severity of community-acquired pneumonia measured as 30-day mortality, and aid in determining care level.
en.use:
CURB-65 is an acronym for Confusion, blood Urea nitrogen level, Respiratory rate, Blood pressure and age (over or equal to) 65. These form the input fields and when present, each factor contributes one (1) additional point to the total score.

Total score ranges from 0-5 and is associated with a risk level, which is in turn associated with certain care level recommendations and a 30-days mortality prediction, as follows:

0-1 points, low risk group. Consider home treatment. 30-day mortality: <3 %.

2 points, moderate risk group. Consider hospital admission. 30-day mortality: 9 %.

3 points, severe risk group. Urgent hospital admission. 30-day mortality: 15-40 %.

4-5 points, highest risk group. Urgent hospital admission, consider ICU admission. 30-day mortality: 15-40 %

CURB-65 score is fast to compute, requires likely already-available patient information, and provides an excellent risk stratification of community acquired pneumonia. It can facilitate better utilization of resources and treatment initiation especially in emergency care settings.
en.misuse: The CURB-65 Score includes points for confusion and blood urea nitrogen, which in the acutely ill elderly patient, could be due to a variety of factors and therefore should be considered with caution while assigning scores. The score does not consider comorbid factors that may affect the mortality due to community-acquired pneumonia.

other_details.references:

Lim WS, Baudouin SV, George RC, et al. BTS guidelines for the management of community acquired pneumonia in adults: update 2009. Thorax. 2009;64(Suppl 3):iii1–iii55.
other_details.en: Estimates mortality of community-acquired pneumonia to help determine inpatient vs. outpatient treatment.

gt0014.description: This rule sums all the individual scores of the input fields to give a total score.

gt0001.description: CURB-65 score is used to predict severity of community-acquired pneumonia, measured as 30-day mortality. It is mainly used for risk stratification to decide further course of treatment.

gt0003.description: Scored as 0 or 1 based on the patient's mental status.

gt0004.description: The respiratory rate (breaths per minute) is observed and scored 0 if <= 30 and 1 if >= 30.

gt0005.description: The patient's blood pressure is checked and both systolic and diastolic are considered to assign a score.

gt0006.description: Scored 0 if patient's age is <= 65 years and 1 if it is 65 years and over that.

gt0007.text: Blood urea nitrogen level >19 mg/dL (>7 mmol/L)?
gt0007.description: Scored 0 if Blood urea nitrogen level is < 19 mg/dL (< 7 mmol/L) and scored 1 if it is > 19 mg/dL (> 7 mmol/L).

gt0009.description: Based on the total score, 4 risk groups are identified.

gt0010.description: Based on the risk group, treatment is recommended in terms of whether home care is sufficient or if the patient should be hospitalised.

gt0011.description: This gives the seveity of the pneumonia in terms of 30-day mortality rate.

gt0013.description: All scored of the input fields are added up to get a total score.

gt0014.description: This rule sums all the individual scores of the input fields to give a total score.

gt0015.description: This rule helps to stratify the patients to a "low" risk group based on the total score.

gt0016.description: This rule helps to stratify the patients to a "moderate" risk group based on the total score.

gt0017.description: This rule helps to stratify the patients to a "severe" risk group based on the total score.
